item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Wednesday, September 4, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Swift creator Chris Lattner on Mojo & Roc (25 points | 7 comments)
2. retronews: TUI browser for HN and Lobsters emulating classical Usenet and mail readers (44 points | 12 comments)
3. Firefox will consider a Rust implementation of JPEG-XL (23 points | 4 comments)
4. YubiKey Security Advisory YSA-2024-03 (23 points | 11 comments)
5. It's not Rust, it's FreeBSD (and LLVM) (29 points | 1 comment)
6. Greppability is an underrated code metric (44 points | 25 comments)
7. LSP: the good, the bad, and the ugly (13 points | 1 comment)
8. Yubikey is the Digital Seat Belt We Need Today (16 points | 23 comments)
9. Setting up a cache server for apt packages (23 points | 6 comments)
10. A TUI for sniffing network traffic using eBPF on Linux (8 points | 1 comment)
11. Is this trait sealed, or not sealed — that is the question (10 points | no comments)
12. In practice, abstractions hide their underlying details (3 points | 1 comment)
13. The Fundamental Law Of Software Dependencies (6 points | 4 comments)
14. How to deadlock Tokio application in Rust with just a single mutex (11 points | 18 comments)
15. gRPC: 5 Years Later, Is It Still Worth It? (6 points | 8 comments)
16. Departure Mono (112 points | 18 comments)
17. Beyond Ctrl-C: The dark corners of Unix signal handling (2 points | no comments)
18. Python Programmers' Experience (16 points | 2 comments)
19. Terminfo, at this point in time, is a net-negative on the terminal ecosystem (50 points | 17 comments)
20. zigimports: Unused imports remover for Zig (6 points | 1 comment)
21. the limb-metaphor for simplicity (3 points | 2 comments)
22. In Leak, Facebook Partner Brags About Listening to Your Phone’s Microphone to Serve Ads for Stuff You Mention (109 points | 130 comments)
23. Generating Chess Puzzles Fast with Rust and Stockfish (6 points | no comments)
24. EUCLEAK: Side-Channel Attack on the YubiKey 5 Series (4 points | no comments)
25. Implementation of Functional Languages Using Custom Hardware (1985) (10 points | 7 comments)
